protocol_name: Western Blot Protocol (Cell Lysate) and Creating Running Gel
protocol_name_html: Western Blot Protocol (Cell Lysate) and Creating Running Gel
description: A basic Western Blot protocol that has been optimized specifically for cell lysates.
before_start: You will need to optimize the weight of your running gel before you begin. Most proteins will be separated with 8%-12% acrylamide gels. If your protein runs off your gel, you will need to use a heavier gel. See step 12 for more information.
manuscript_citation: Pointer, C., Wenzel, T.J., Klegeris, A. (2018). Extracellular Cardiolipin Regulates Select Immune Functions of Microglia. In review.
keywords: Western blot, proteomics, protein, antibody, protocol, immunology, neuroimmunology
status_info: I use this protocol to quantify proteins in all my western blot protocols. This protocol consistently develops.

components.data: CELL PROTEIN PREPARATION PROCEDURE
components.name: Section

components.data:
Seed 2mL of cells at desired density in 6mL TC-coated petri dish

 

Note: Attached to this step is a document that has all the solutions described in this protocol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Seed 2mL of cells at desired density in 6mL TC-coated petri dish

 

Note: Attached to this step is a document that has all the solutions described in this protocol.

components.data: Drug and stimulate cells as desired
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Drug and stimulate cells as desired

components.data: Wash cells with ice-cold PBS
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash cells with ice-cold PBS

components.data: Aspirate the PBS and add 0.3mL ice-cold RIPA buffer
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Aspirate the PBS and add 0.3mL ice-cold RIPA buffer

components.data: Incubate 5 min on ice
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate 5 min on ice

components.data: Scrape cells off the dish using a cold plastic cell scraper and transfer to a 0.5mL microcentrifuge tube
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Scrape cells off the dish using a cold plastic cell scraper and transfer to a 0.5mL microcentrifuge tube

components.data: Centrifuge the samples at 10000xg for 5 minutes
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the samples at 10000xg for 5 minutes

components.data: Pipette the supernatant (containing the protein) into a fresh 1.5mL centrifuge tube, discard the pellet
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette the supernatant (containing the protein) into a fresh 1.5mL centrifuge tube, discard the pellet

components.data: Clean gel plates with distilled water (make sure they are “1.0mm” plates)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Clean gel plates with distilled water (make sure they are “1.0mm” plates)

components.data: GEL PREPARATION PROCEDURE (DAY 1)
components.name: Section

components.data: Place plates into green casting frame
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place plates into green casting frame

components.data: Place casting frame (with plates) into the casting stand
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place casting frame (with plates) into the casting stand

components.data:
Make lower gel.

 

If using a bigger protein, use a lower gel mix percentage

 

Guidelines for Acrylamide % in Gels

<60kDa = 12%

60-110 kDa = 10%

>110 kDa = 8%

 

IMPORTANT: Do NOT add TEMED until you’re ready to start pouring the gel, as it will begin gel solidification
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Make lower gel.

 

If using a bigger protein, use a lower gel mix percentage

 

Guidelines for Acrylamide % in Gels

<60kDa = 12%

60-110 kDa = 10%

>110 kDa = 8%

 

IMPORTANT: Do NOT add TEMED until you’re ready to start pouring the gel, as it will begin gel solidification

components.data: Have gel components (minus the TEMED) and ethanol ready
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Have gel components (minus the TEMED) and ethanol ready

components.data: Add TEMED to gel components and immediately pour the lower gel between the plates
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add TEMED to gel components and immediately pour the lower gel between the plates

components.data: Add 100uL-1mL ethanol over top of the lower gel until it is even
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100uL-1mL ethanol over top of the lower gel until it is even

components.data:
Let the lower gel sit for 20 minutes to solidify.

 

During this time you can:

  1. Make 1x Laemelli Running Buffer
  2. Make 1x Towbin Transfer Buffer
  3. Make upper gel
  4. Get plastic lane combs (make sure they are 1.0mm)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Let the lower gel sit for 20 minutes to solidify.

 

During this time you can:

  1. Make 1x Laemelli Running Buffer
  2. Make 1x Towbin Transfer Buffer
  3. Make upper gel
  4. Get plastic lane combs (make sure they are 1.0mm)

components.data: Pour out ethanol above lower gel
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pour out ethanol above lower gel

components.data: Wash lower gel with distilled water once
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash lower gel with distilled water once

components.data: Pour out distilled water above lower gel
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pour out distilled water above lower gel

components.data: Remove excess distilled water using the corner of a piece of Whatman paper (do NOT touch the gel)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove excess distilled water using the corner of a piece of Whatman paper (do NOT touch the gel)

components.data: Add TEMED to the upper gel components and immediately pour the upper gel overtop the lower gel until overflowing
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add TEMED to the upper gel components and immediately pour the upper gel overtop the lower gel until overflowing

components.data: Immediately add lane combs to the stacking gel, making sure there are no bubbles
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immediately add lane combs to the stacking gel, making sure there are no bubbles

components.data:
Let upper gel sit for 10 minutes to solidify

  1. During this time you can:
    1. Boil ladder (11uL Biotin ladder mixed with 11uL Opti Marker ladder) in water bath for 2 minutes – hold tube with tongs
    2. Boil proteins in heating block containing water at 90oC for 4 minutes
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Let upper gel sit for 10 minutes to solidify

  1. During this time you can:
    1. Boil ladder (11uL Biotin ladder mixed with 11uL Opti Marker ladder) in water bath for 2 minutes – hold tube with tongs
    2. Boil proteins in heating block containing water at 90oC for 4 minutes

components.data: Carefully remove lane combs from the upper gel
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully remove lane combs from the upper gel

components.data: Wash once with distilled water by causing the water to overflow out of the casting frame
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash once with distilled water by causing the water to overflow out of the casting frame

components.data: Move gel plates to a clamping frame and place in a gel running box
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Move gel plates to a clamping frame and place in a gel running box

components.data: RUNNING WESTERN BLOT PROCEDURE (DAY 1):
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 1x Laemmli running buffer just below the top of the plates, and to the appropriate line in the gel box
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1x Laemmli running buffer just below the top of the plates, and to the appropriate line in the gel box

components.data: Make sure there are no bubbles where the gels are by aspirating the bubbles off
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Make sure there are no bubbles where the gels are by aspirating the bubbles off

components.data: Add 10uL of sample to each gel lane, by slowly releasing sample until the first pipette stop (you will need to run a standard curve of various volumes to determine which volume to use; you want to make sure you can detect higher and lower protein concentrations and do not saturate the bands)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 10uL of sample to each gel lane, by slowly releasing sample until the first pipette stop (you will need to run a standard curve of various volumes to determine which volume to use; you want to make sure you can detect higher and lower protein concentrations and do not saturate the bands)

components.data: Run the gel at 160V (3.00A) at room temperature until the dye front begins to run off the bottom (usually 1h20min)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run the gel at 160V (3.00A) at room temperature until the dye front begins to run off the bottom (usually 1h20min)

components.data:
While gel is running:

  1. Cut and label nitrocellulose membranes
  2. Cut Whatman paper (if necessary)
  3. Wash sponges in distilled water
  4. Make 1x Towbin transfer buffer
  5. Get a plastic tray to work in
  6. Label transfer boxes
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
While gel is running:

  1. Cut and label nitrocellulose membranes
  2. Cut Whatman paper (if necessary)
  3. Wash sponges in distilled water
  4. Make 1x Towbin transfer buffer
  5. Get a plastic tray to work in
  6. Label transfer boxes

components.data: WESTERN BLOT TRANSFER AND QUANTIFICATION PROCEDURE (DAY 1)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: WESTERN BLOT TRANSFER AND QUANTIFICATION PROCEDURE (DAY 1)

components.data:
Once gel is complete, make your gel sandwiches for protein transfer onto the nitrocellulose membranes

 

Gel sandwich (from black side to clear side)

  1. Black sponge
  2. White Sponge
  3. 1 Piece of Whatman paper
  4. Gel
  5. Nitrocellulose membrane (with writing face down against the gel)
  6. 1 piece of Whatman paper
    1. Roll out air bubbles gently (use a roller, 50mL conical w/o lid, etc.)
  1. 2 pieces of Whatman paper
  2. White sponge
  3. Black sponge
    1. Roll out air bubbles firmly (use a roller, 50mL conical w/o lid, etc.)
  4. Seal gel sandwich and place in transfer box (black side of sandwich chamber should face black side of transfer box)
  5. Add an ice pack to the transfer box
  6. Fill area around transfer box with packed ice
  7. Fill transfer box with 1x Towbin transfer buffer
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Once gel is complete, make your gel sandwiches for protein transfer onto the nitrocellulose membranes

 

Gel sandwich (from black side to clear side)

  1. Black sponge
  2. White Sponge
  3. 1 Piece of Whatman paper
  4. Gel
  5. Nitrocellulose membrane (with writing face down against the gel)
  6. 1 piece of Whatman paper
    1. Roll out air bubbles gently (use a roller, 50mL conical w/o lid, etc.)
  1. 2 pieces of Whatman paper
  2. White sponge
  3. Black sponge
    1. Roll out air bubbles firmly (use a roller, 50mL conical w/o lid, etc.)
  4. Seal gel sandwich and place in transfer box (black side of sandwich chamber should face black side of transfer box)
  5. Add an ice pack to the transfer box
  6. Fill area around transfer box with packed ice
  7. Fill transfer box with 1x Towbin transfer buffer

components.data:
Run protein transfer at a current of 0.30A for 1h 15min (you will need to set a higher voltage but press run when current is selected)

Meanwhile, you can make 10mL Blocking Solution and store at 4oC (5% w/v Skim Milk Powder in TBS-T)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Run protein transfer at a current of 0.30A for 1h 15min (you will need to set a higher voltage but press run when current is selected)

Meanwhile, you can make 10mL Blocking Solution and store at 4oC (5% w/v Skim Milk Powder in TBS-T)

components.data:
After protein transfer, move the membrane to a small membrane Tupperware box

 

Ponceau stain the nitrocellulose membrane to visualize transferred proteins and warm up camera

 

Take a picture of the stained transferred proteins with a 18-70mm lens
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
After protein transfer, move the membrane to a small membrane Tupperware box

 

Ponceau stain the nitrocellulose membrane to visualize transferred proteins and warm up camera

 

Take a picture of the stained transferred proteins with a 18-70mm lens

components.data: Wash membranes 3 times on a shaker with TBS-T for 5 minutes to remove Ponceau stain in shaker. Ensure there is no color left.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash membranes 3 times on a shaker with TBS-T for 5 minutes to remove Ponceau stain in shaker. Ensure there is no color left.

components.data: Add Blocking Solution to the membrane Tupperware box and shake for 1h
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add Blocking Solution to the membrane Tupperware box and shake for 1h

components.data: Pour off excess Blocking Solution
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pour off excess Blocking Solution

components.data:
Add on 1o antibody dissolved in blocking solution (usually 1:1000 dilution) into membrane Tupperware box and shake overnight at 4o C. STORE EMPTY CONICALS IN FRIDGE OVERNIGHT as you can use the 1o antibody for months.

 

Note: You can add the 1o antibody for only an hour at room temperature, but your bands will be less clear and there may be more background bands.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add on 1o antibody dissolved in blocking solution (usually 1:1000 dilution) into membrane Tupperware box and shake overnight at 4o C. STORE EMPTY CONICALS IN FRIDGE OVERNIGHT as you can use the 1o antibody for months.

 

Note: You can add the 1o antibody for only an hour at room temperature, but your bands will be less clear and there may be more background bands.

components.data: WESTERN BLOT TRANSFER AND QUANTIFICATION PROCEDURE (DAY 2)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: WESTERN BLOT TRANSFER AND QUANTIFICATION PROCEDURE (DAY 2)

components.data: Place 1o antibodies back in the stored 50mL conical and freeze for reuse
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place 1o antibodies back in the stored 50mL conical and freeze for reuse

components.data: Wash membrane with TBS-T at room temperature for 1h on a shaker (add TBS-T every 10 minutes)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash membrane with TBS-T at room temperature for 1h on a shaker (add TBS-T every 10 minutes)

components.data: Add on 2o antibody dissolved in blocking solution into membrane Tupperware box and shake at room temperature for 1h
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add on 2o antibody dissolved in blocking solution into membrane Tupperware box and shake at room temperature for 1h

components.data: Wash membrane with TBS-T at room temperature for 1h on a shaker (add TBS-T every 10 minutes) and turn on chemiluminescent camera at this time
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash membrane with TBS-T at room temperature for 1h on a shaker (add TBS-T every 10 minutes) and turn on chemiluminescent camera at this time

components.data: Dry off membrane in Saran wrap and place in a new Tupperware container
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dry off membrane in Saran wrap and place in a new Tupperware container

components.data: Develop and Quantify Blots
components.name: Section

components.data: Make ECL solution
components.name: Section

components.data:
Add 1mL light ECL reagents (per membrane) and 1mL dark ECL reagent (per membrane) into a 15mL conical

 

Important: Change tips to avoid contaminating ECL reagents)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add 1mL light ECL reagents (per membrane) and 1mL dark ECL reagent (per membrane) into a 15mL conical

 

Important: Change tips to avoid contaminating ECL reagents)

components.data: With a 1mL pipette, add 2mL ECL solution over the membrane drop by drop until covered
components.name: Description

source_data.description: With a 1mL pipette, add 2mL ECL solution over the membrane drop by drop until covered

components.data: Cover the membrane box (with aluminum foil) for 5 minutes
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cover the membrane box (with aluminum foil) for 5 minutes

components.data: Take picture using chemiluminescent machine in the anteroom
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Take picture using chemiluminescent machine in the anteroom

components.data:
Take picture at 70mm using the 18-70mm lens, using the aperture ring to get the correct exposure

OR the settings that are specific to the chemiluminescent machine available in your lab.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Take picture at 70mm using the 18-70mm lens, using the aperture ring to get the correct exposure

OR the settings that are specific to the chemiluminescent machine available in your lab.
